verses.textEn: So then, notice the goodness and the severity of God. Certainly, toward those who have fallen, there is severity; but toward you, there is the goodness of God, if you remain in goodness. Otherwise, you also will be cut off.
verses.textLa: Vide ergo bonitatem, et severitatem Dei: in eos quidem, qui ceciderunt, severitatem: in te autem bonitatem Dei, si permanseris in bonitate, alioquin et tu excideris.

verses.textEn: Moreover, if they do not remain in unbelief, they will be grafted on. For God is able to graft them on again.
verses.textLa: Sed et illi, si non permanserint in incredulitate, inserentur: potens est enim Deus iterum inserere illos.

verses.textEn: So if you have been cut off from the wild olive tree, which is natural to you, and, contrary to nature, you are grafted on to the good olive tree, how much more shall those who are the natural branches be grafted on to their own olive tree?
verses.textLa: Nam si tu ex naturali excisus es oleastro, et contra naturam insertus es in bonam olivam: quanto magis ii, qui secundum naturam, inserentur suæ olivæ?

verses.textEn: For I do not want you to be ignorant, brothers, of this mystery (lest you seem wise only to yourselves) that a certain blindness has occurred in Israel, until the fullness of the Gentiles has arrived.
verses.textLa: Nolo enim vos ignorare fratres mysterium hoc: (ut non sitis vobis ipsis sapientes) quia cæcitas ex parte contigit in Israel, donec plenitudo Gentium intraret,
verses.notes: The phrase ‘ex parte’ in this context means that the blindness is not complete, but is a particular blindness, or partial blindness, in other words, a certain kind of blindness.

verses.textEn: And in this way, all of Israel may be saved, just as it was written: “From Zion shall arrive he who delivers, and he shall turn impiety away from Jacob.
verses.textLa: et sic omnis Israel salvus fieret, sicut scriptum est: Veniet ex Sion, qui eripiat, et avertat impietatem a Iacob.

verses.textEn: And this will be my covenant for them, when I will take away their sins.”
verses.textLa: Et hoc illis a me testamentum: cum abstulero peccata eorum.

verses.textEn: Certainly, according to the Gospel, they are enemies for your sake. But according to the election, they are most beloved for the sake of the fathers.
verses.textLa: Secundum Evangelium quidem, inimici propter vos: secundum electionem autem, charissimi propter patres.

verses.textEn: For the gifts and the call of God are without regret.
verses.textLa: Sine pœnitentia enim sunt dona, et vocatio Dei.

verses.textEn: And just as you also, in times past, did not believe in God, but now you have obtained mercy because of their unbelief,
verses.textLa: Sicut enim aliquando et vos non credidistis Deo, nunc autem misericordiam consecuti estis propter incredulitatem illorum:

verses.textEn: so also have these now not believed, for your mercy, so that they might obtain mercy also.
verses.textLa: ita et isti nunc non crediderunt in vestram misericordiam: ut et ipsi misericordiam consequantur.

verses.textEn: For God has enclosed everyone in unbelief, so that he may have mercy on everyone.
verses.textLa: Conclusit enim Deus omnia in incredulitate: ut omnium misereatur.

verses.textEn: Oh, the depths of the richness of the wisdom and knowledge of God! How incomprehensible are his judgments, and how unsearchable are his ways!
verses.textLa: O altitudo divitiarum sapientiæ, et scientiæ Dei: quam incomprehensibilia sunt iudicia eius, et investigabiles viæ eius!

verses.textEn: For who has known the mind of the Lord? Or who has been his counselor?
verses.textLa: Quis enim cognovit sensum Domini? Aut quis consiliarius eius fuit?

verses.textEn: Or who first gave to him, so that repayment would be owed?
verses.textLa: Aut quis prior dedit illi, et retribuetur ei?

verses.textEn: For from him, and through him, and in him are all things. To him is glory, for all eternity. Amen.
verses.textLa: Quoniam ex ipso, et per ipsum, et in ipso sunt omnia: ipsi gloria in sæcula. Amen.

verses.textEn: And so, I beg you, brothers, by the mercy of God, that you offer your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy and pleasing to God, with the subservience of your mind.
verses.textLa: Obsecro itaque vos fratres per misericordiam Dei, ut exhibeatis corpora vestra hostiam viventem, sanctam, Deo placentem, rationabile obsequium vestrum.
verses.notes: Paul is saying that when you offer your bodies as a living sacrifice, this must include the submission of will and intellect to God. In the next verse, he goes on to warn about being conformed (in will and intellect) to the ideas and ways of the modern age.

verses.textEn: And do not choose to be conformed to this age, but instead choose to be reformed in the newness of your mind, so that you may demonstrate what is the will of God: what is good, and what is well-pleasing, and what is perfect.
verses.textLa: Et nolite conformari huic sæculo, sed reformamini in novitate sensus vestri: ut probetis quæ sit voluntas Dei bona, et beneplacens, et perfecta.

verses.textEn: For I say, through the grace that has been given to me, to all who are among you: Taste no more than it is necessary to taste, but taste unto sobriety and just as God has distributed a share of the faith to each one.
verses.textLa: Dico enim per gratiam quæ data est mihi, omnibus qui sunt inter vos: Non plus sapere quam oportet sapere, sed sapere ad sobrietatem: et unicuique sicut Deus divisit mensuram fidei.

verses.textEn: For just as, within one body, we have many parts, though all the parts do not have the same role,
verses.textLa: Sicut enim in uno corpore multa membra habemus, omnia autem membra non eumdem actum habent:

verses.textEn: so also we, being many, are one body in Christ, and each one is a part, the one of the other.
verses.textLa: ita multi unum corpus sumus in Christo, singuli autem alter alterius membra.

verses.textEn: And we each have different gifts, according to the grace that has been given to us: whether prophecy, in agreement with the reasonableness of faith;
verses.textLa: Habentes autem donationes secundum gratiam, quæ data est nobis, differentes: sive prophetiam secundum rationem fidei,

verses.textEn: or ministry, in ministering; or he who teaches, in doctrine;
verses.textLa: sive ministerium in ministrando, sive qui docet in doctrina,

verses.textEn: he who exhorts, in exhortation; he who gives, in simplicity; he who governs, in solicitude; he who shows mercy, in cheerfulness.
verses.textLa: qui exhortatur in exhortando, qui tribuit in simplicitate, qui præest in sollicitudine, qui miseretur in hilaritate.

verses.textEn: Let love be without falseness: hating evil, clinging to what is good,
verses.textLa: Dilectio sine simulatione: Odientes malum, adhærentes bono:

verses.textEn: loving one another with fraternal charity, surpassing one another in honor:
verses.textLa: charitate fraternitatis invicem diligentes: Honore invicem prævenientes:

verses.textEn: in solicitude, not lazy; in spirit, fervent; serving the Lord;
verses.textLa: Solicitudine non pigri: spiritu ferventes: Domino servientes:

verses.textEn: in hope, rejoicing; in tribulation, enduring; in prayer, ever-willing;
verses.textLa: Spe gaudentes: In tribulatione patientes: Orationi instantes:

verses.textEn: in the difficulties of the saints, sharing; in hospitality, attentive.
verses.textLa: Necessitatibus sanctorum communicantes: Hospitalitatem sectantes.

verses.textEn: Bless those who are persecuting you: bless, and do not curse.
verses.textLa: Benedicite persequentibus vos: benedicite, et nolite maledicere.

verses.textEn: Rejoice with those who are rejoicing. Weep with those who are weeping.
verses.textLa: Gaudere cum gaudentibus, flere cum flentibus:

verses.textEn: Be of the same mind toward one another: not savoring what is exalted, but consenting in humility. Do not choose to seem wise to yourself.
verses.textLa: Idipsum invicem sentientes: Non alta sapientes, sed humilibus consentientes. Nolite esse prudentes apud vosmetipsos:

verses.textEn: Render to no one harm for harm. Provide good things, not only in the sight of God, but also in the sight of all men.
verses.textLa: Nulli malum pro malo reddentes: providentes bona non tantum coram Deo, sed etiam coram omnibus hominibus.

verses.textEn: If it is possible, in so far as you are able, be at peace with all men.
verses.textLa: Si fieri potest, quod ex vobis est, cum omnibus hominibus pacem habentes:

verses.textEn: Do not defend yourselves, dearest ones. Instead, step aside from wrath. For it is written: “Vengeance is mine. I shall give retribution, says the Lord.”
verses.textLa: Non vosmetipsos defendentes charissimi, sed date locum iræ. Scriptum est enim: Mihi vindicta: ego retribuam, dicit Dominus.

verses.textEn: So if an enemy is hungry, feed him; if he is thirsty, give him a drink. For in doing so, you will heap burning coals upon his head.
verses.textLa: Sed si esurierit inimicus tuus, ciba illum: si sitit, potum da illi: hoc enim faciens, carbones ignis congeres super caput eius.

verses.textEn: Do not allow evil to prevail, instead prevail over evil by means of goodness.
verses.textLa: Noli vinci a malo, sed vince in bono malum.

verses.textEn: Let every soul be subject to higher authorities. For there is no authority except from God and those who have been ordained by God.
verses.textLa: Omnis anima potestatibus sublimioribus subdita sit: Non est enim potestas nisi a Deo: quæ autem sunt, a Deo ordinatæ sunt.

verses.textEn: And so, whoever resists authority, resists what has been ordained by God. And those who resist are acquiring damnation for themselves.
verses.textLa: Itaque qui resistit potestati, Dei ordinationi resistit. Qui autem resistunt, ipsi sibi damnationem acquirunt:

verses.textEn: For leaders are not a source of fear to those who work good, but to those who work evil. And would you prefer not to be afraid of authority? Then do what is good, and you shall have praise from them.
verses.textLa: nam principes non sunt timori boni operis, sed mali. Vis autem non timere potestatem? Bonum fac: et habebis laudem ex illa:

verses.textEn: For he is a minister of God for you unto good. But if you do what is evil, be afraid. For it is not without reason that he carries a sword. For he is a minister of God; an avenger to execute wrath upon whomever does evil.
verses.textLa: Dei enim minister est tibi in bonum. Si autem malum feceris, time: non enim sine causa gladium portat. Dei enim minister est: vindex in iram ei, qui malum agit.

verses.textEn: For this reason, it is necessary to be subject, not solely because of wrath, but also because of conscience.
verses.textLa: Ideo necessitate subditi estote non solum propter iram, sed etiam propter conscientiam.

verses.textEn: Therefore, you must also offer tribute. For they are the ministers of God, serving him in this.
verses.textLa: Ideo enim et tributa præstatis: ministri enim Dei sunt, in hoc ipsum servientes.

verses.textEn: Therefore, render to all whatever is owed. Taxes, to whom taxes is due; revenue, to whom revenue is due; fear, to whom fear is due; honor, to whom honor is due.
verses.textLa: Reddite ergo omnibus debita: cui tribulatum, tributum: cui vectigal, vectigal: cui timorem, timorem: cui honorem, honorem.

verses.textEn: You should owe nothing to anyone, except so as to love one another. For whoever loves his neighbor has fulfilled the law.
verses.textLa: Nemini quidquam debeatis: nisi ut invicem diligatis: qui enim diligit proximum, legem implevit.

verses.textEn: For example: You shall not commit adultery. You shall not kill. You shall not steal. You shall not speak false testimony. You shall not covet. And if there is any other commandment, it is summed up in this word: You shall love your neighbor as yourself.
verses.textLa: Nam: Non adulterabis: Non occides: Non furaberis: Non falsum testimonium dices: Non concupisces: et si quod est aliud mandatum, in hoc verbo instauratur: Diliges proximum tuum sicut teipsum.

verses.textEn: The love of neighbor does no harm. Therefore, love is the plenitude of the law.
verses.textLa: Dilectio proximi malum non operatur. Plenitudo ergo legis est dilectio.

verses.textEn: And we know the present time, that now is the hour for us to rise up from sleep. For already our salvation is closer than when we first believed.
verses.textLa: Et hoc scientes tempus: quia hora est iam nos de somno surgere. Nunc enim propior est nostra salus, quam cum credidimus.

verses.textEn: The night has passed, and the day draws near. Therefore, let us cast aside the works of darkness, and be clothed with the armor of light.
verses.textLa: Nox præcessit, dies autem appropinquavit. Abiiciamus ergo opera tenebrarum, et induamur arma lucis.

verses.textEn: Let us walk honestly, as in the daylight, not in carousing and drunkenness, not in promiscuity and sexual immorality, not in contention and envy.
verses.textLa: Sicut in die honeste ambulemus: non in comessationibus, et ebrietatibus, non in cubilibus, et impudicitiis, non in contentione, et æmulatione:

verses.textEn: Instead, be clothed with the Lord Jesus Christ, and make no provision for the flesh in its desires.
verses.textLa: sed induamini Dominum Iesum Christum, et carnis curam ne feceritis in desideriis.

verses.textEn: But accept those who are weak in faith, without disputing about ideas.
verses.textLa: Infirmum autem in fide assumite, non in disceptationibus cogitationum.

verses.textEn: For one person believes that he may eat all things, but if another is weak, let him eat plants.
verses.textLa: Alius enim credit se manducare omnia: qui autem infirmus est, olus manducet.

verses.textEn: He who eats should not despise him who does not eat. And he who does not eat should not judge him who eats. For God has accepted him.
verses.textLa: Is, qui manducat, non manducantem non spernat: et qui non manducat, manducantem non iudicet: Deus enim illum assumpsit.

verses.textEn: Who are you to judge the servant of another? He stands or falls by his own Lord. But he shall stand. For God is able to make him stand.
verses.textLa: Tu quis es, qui iudicas alienum servum? Domino suo stat, aut cadit: stabit autem: potens est enim Deus statuere illum.

verses.textEn: For one person discerns one age from the next. But another discerns unto every age. Let each one increase according to his own mind.
verses.textLa: Nam alius iudicat diem inter diem: alius autem iudicat omnem diem: unusquisque in suo sensu abundet.
verses.notes: The one who eats discerns that, in this present age (New Testament times), eating formerly-unclean foods is permitted, even though it was not permitted in the previous age (Old Testament times). The one who discerns unto every age refrains from eating, for self-denial and self-restraint is permitted in every age.

verses.textEn: He who understands the age, understands for the Lord. And he who eats, eats for the Lord; for he gives thanks to God. And he who does not eat, does not eat for the Lord, and he gives thanks to God.
verses.textLa: Qui sapit diem, Domino sapit: Et qui manducat, Domino manducat: gratias enim agit Deo. Et qui non manducat, Domino non manducat, et gratias agit Deo.

verses.textEn: For none of us lives for himself, and none of us dies for himself.
verses.textLa: Nemo enim nostrum sibi vivit, et nemo sibi moritur.

verses.textEn: For if we live, we live for the Lord, and if we die, we die for the Lord. Therefore, whether we live or die, we belong to the Lord.
verses.textLa: Sive enim vivemus, Domino vivimus: sive morimur, Domino morimur. Sive ergo vivimus, sive morimur, Domini sumus.

verses.textEn: For Christ died and rose again for this purpose: that he might be the ruler of both the dead and the living.
verses.textLa: In hoc enim Christus mortuus est, et resurrexit: ut et mortuorum et vivorum dominetur.

verses.textEn: So then, why do you judge your brother? Or why do you despise your brother? For we shall all stand before the judgment seat of Christ.
verses.textLa: Tu autem quid iudicas fratrem tuum? Aut tu quare spernis fratrem tuum? Omnes enim stabimus ante tribunal Christi.

verses.textEn: For it is written: “As I live, says the Lord, every knee shall bend to me, and every tongue shall confess to God.”
verses.textLa: Scriptum est enim: Vivo ego, dicit Dominus, quoniam mihi flectetur omne genu: et omnis lingua confitebitur Deo.

verses.textEn: And so, each one of us shall offer an explanation of himself to God.
verses.textLa: Itaque unusquisque nostrum pro se rationem reddet Deo.

verses.textEn: Therefore, we should no longer judge one another. Instead, judge this to a greater extent: that you should not place an obstacle before your brother, nor lead him astray.
verses.textLa: Non ergo amplius invicem iudicemus: sed hoc iudicate magis, ne ponatis offendiculum fratri, vel scandalum.

verses.textEn: I know, with confidence in the Lord Jesus, that nothing is unclean in and of itself. But to him who considers anything to be unclean, it is unclean to him.
verses.textLa: Scio, et confido in Domino Iesu, quia nihil commune per ipsum, nisi ei qui existimat quid commune esset, illi commune est.
verses.notes: The word ‘commune’ can be translated as ‘unclean’ or as ‘common.’

verses.textEn: For if your brother is grieved because of your food, you are not now walking according to love. Do not allow your food to destroy him for whom Christ died.
verses.textLa: Si enim propter cibum frater tuus contristatur: iam non secundum charitatem ambulas. Noli cibo tuo illum perdere, pro quo Christus mortuus est.

verses.textEn: Therefore, what is good for us should not be a cause of blasphemy.
verses.textLa: Non ergo blasphemetur bonum nostrum.

verses.textEn: For the kingdom of God is not food and drink, but rather justice and peace and joy, in the Holy Spirit.
verses.textLa: Non est enim regnum Dei esca, et potus: sed iustitia, et pax, et gaudium in Spiritu Sancto:

verses.textEn: For he who serves Christ in this, pleases God and is proven before men.
verses.textLa: qui enim in hoc servit Christo, placet Deo, et probatus est hominibus.

verses.textEn: And so, let us pursue the things that are of peace, and let us keep to the things that are for the edification of one another.
verses.textLa: Itaque quæ pacis sunt, sectemur: et quæ ædificationis sunt, in invicem custodiamus.

verses.textEn: Do not be willing to destroy the work of God because of food. Certainly, all things are clean. But there is harm for a man who offends by eating.
verses.textLa: Noli propter escam destruere opus Dei. Omnia quidem sunt munda: sed malum est homini, qui per offendiculum manducat.

verses.textEn: It is good to refrain from eating meat and from drinking wine, and from anything by which your brother is offended, or led astray, or weakened.
verses.textLa: Bonum est non manducare carnem, et non bibere vinum, neque in quo frater tuus offenditur, aut scandalizatur, aut infirmatur.

verses.textEn: Do you have faith? It belongs to you, so hold it before God. Blessed is he who does not judge himself in that by which he is tested.
verses.textLa: Tu fidem habes? Penes temetipsum habe coram Deo: Beatus, qui non iudicat semetipsum in eo, quod probat.

verses.textEn: But he who discerns, if he eats, is condemned, because it is not of faith. For all that is not of faith is sin.
verses.textLa: Qui autem discernit, si manducaverit, damnatus est: quia non ex fide. Omne autem, quod non est ex fide, peccatum est.

verses.textEn: But we who are stronger must bear with the feebleness of the weak, and not so as to please ourselves.
verses.textLa: Debemus autem nos firmiores imbecillitates infirmorum sustinere, et non nobis placere.

verses.textEn: Each one of you should please his neighbor unto good, for edification.
verses.textLa: Unusquisque vestrum proximo suo placeat in bonum, ad ædificationem.

verses.textEn: For even Christ did not please himself, but as it was written: “The reproaches of those who reproached you fell upon me.”
verses.textLa: Etenim Christus non sibi placuit, sed sicut scriptum est: Improperia improperantium tibi ceciderunt super me.

verses.textEn: For whatever was written, was written to teach us, so that, through patience and the consolation of the Scriptures, we might have hope.
verses.textLa: Quæcumque enim scripta sunt, ad nostram doctrinam scripta sunt: ut per patientiam, et consolationem Scripturarum, spem habeamus.

verses.textEn: So may the God of patience and solace grant you to be of one mind toward one another, in accord with Jesus Christ,
verses.textLa: Deus autem patientiæ, et solatii det vobis idipsum sapere in alterutrum secundum Iesum Christum:

verses.textEn: so that, together with one mouth, you may glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.textLa: ut unanimes, uno ore honorificetis Deum, et patrem Domini nostri Iesu Christi.

verses.textEn: For this reason, accept one another, just as Christ also has accepted you, in the honor of God.
verses.textLa: Propter quod suscipite invicem, sicut et Christus suscepit vos in honorem Dei.

verses.textEn: For I declare that Christ Jesus was the minister of circumcision because of the truth of God, so as to confirm the promises to the fathers,
verses.textLa: Dico enim Christum Iesum ministrum fuisse circumcisionis propter veritatem Dei, ad confirmandas promissiones patrum:

verses.textEn: and that the Gentiles are to honor God because of his mercy, just as it was written: “Because of this, I will confess you among the Gentiles, O Lord, and I will sing to your name.”
verses.textLa: Gentes autem super misericordia honorare Deum, sicut scriptum est: Propterea confitebor tibi in Gentibus Domine, et nomini tuo cantabo.

verses.textEn: And again, he says: “Rejoice, O Gentiles, along with his people.”
verses.textLa: Et iterum dicit: Lætamini Gentes cum plebe eius.

verses.textEn: And again: “All Gentiles, praise the Lord; and all peoples, magnify him.”
verses.textLa: Et iterum: Laudate omnes Gentes Dominum: et magnificate eum omnes populi.

verses.textEn: And again, Isaiah says: “There shall be a root of Jesse, and he shall rise up to rule the Gentiles, and in him the Gentiles shall hope.”
verses.textLa: Et rursus Isaias ait: Erit radix Iesse, et qui exurget regere Gentes, in eum Gentes sperabunt.

verses.textEn: So may the God of hope fill you with every joy and with peace in believing, so that you may abound in hope and in the virtue of the Holy Spirit.
verses.textLa: Deus autem spei repleat vos omni gaudio, et pace in credendo: ut abundetis in spe, et virtute Spiritus Sancti.

verses.textEn: But I am also certain about you, my brothers, that you also have been filled with love, completed with all knowledge, so that you are able to admonish one another.
verses.textLa: Certus sum autem fratres mei et ego ipse de vobis, quoniam et ipsi pleni estis dilectione, repleti omni scientia, ita ut possitis alterutrum monere.

verses.textEn: But I have written to you, brothers, more boldly than to the others, as if calling you to mind again, because of the grace which has been given to me from God,
verses.textLa: Audacius autem scripsi vobis fratres ex parte, tamquam in memoriam vos reducens: propter gratiam, quæ data est mihi a Deo,

verses.textEn: so that I may be a minister of Christ Jesus among the Gentiles, sanctifying the Gospel of God, in order that the oblation of the Gentiles may be made acceptable and may be sanctified in the Holy Spirit.
verses.textLa: ut sim minister Christi Iesu in Gentibus: sanctificans Evangelium Dei, ut fiat oblatio Gentium accepta, et sanctificata in Spiritu Sancto.

verses.textEn: Therefore, I have glory in Christ Jesus before God.
verses.textLa: Habeo igitur gloriam in Christo Iesu ad Deum.

verses.textEn: So I dare not speak of any of those things which Christ does not effect through me, unto the obedience of the Gentiles, in word and deed,
verses.textLa: Non enim audeo aliquid loqui eorum, quæ per me non efficit Christus in obedientiam Gentium, verbo et factis:

verses.textEn: with the power of signs and wonders, by power of the Holy Spirit. For in this way, from Jerusalem, throughout its surroundings, as far as Illyricum, I have replenished the Gospel of Christ.
verses.textLa: in virtute signorum, et prodigiorum, in virtute Spiritus Sancti: ita ut ab Ierusalem per circuitum usque ad Illyricum repleverim Evangelium Christi.

verses.textEn: And so I have preached this Gospel, not where Christ was known by name, lest I build upon the foundation of another,
verses.textLa: Sic autem prædicavi Evangelium hoc, non ubi nominatus est Christus, ne super alienum fundamentum ædificarem:

verses.textEn: but just as it was written: “Those to whom he was not announced shall perceive, and those who have not heard shall understand.”
verses.textLa: sed sicut scriptum est: Quibus non est annunciatum de eo, videbunt: et qui non audierunt, intelligent.

verses.textEn: Because of this also, I was greatly hindered in coming to you, and I have been prevented until the present time.
verses.textLa: Propter quod et impediebar plurimum venire ad vos, et prohibitus sum usque adhuc.

verses.textEn: Yet truly now, having no other destination in these regions, and having already had a great desire to come to you over the past many years,
verses.textLa: Nunc vero ulterius locum non habens in his regionibus, cupiditatem autem habens veniendi ad vos ex multis iam præcedentibus annis:

verses.textEn: when I begin to set out on my journey to Spain, I hope that, as I pass by, I may see you, and I may be guided from there by you, after first having borne some fruit among you.
verses.textLa: cum in Hispaniam proficisci cœpero, spero quod præteriens videam vos, et a vobis deducar illuc, si vobis primum ex parte fruitus fuero.

verses.textEn: But next I will set out for Jerusalem, to minister to the saints.
verses.textLa: Nunc igitur proficiscar in Ierusalem ministrare sanctis.

verses.textEn: For those of Macedonia and Achaia have decided to make a collection for those of the poor among the saints who are at Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: Probaverunt enim Macedonia, et Achaia collationem aliquam facere in pauperes sanctorum, qui sunt in Ierusalem.

verses.textEn: And this has pleased them, because they are in their debt. For, since the Gentiles have become partakers of their spiritual things, they also ought to minister to them in worldly things.
verses.textLa: Placuit enim eis: et debitores sunt eorum. Nam si spiritualium eorum participes facti sunt Gentiles: debent et in carnalibus ministrare illis.

verses.textEn: Therefore, when I have completed this task, and have consigned to them this fruit, I shall set out, by way of you, to Spain.
verses.textLa: Hoc igitur cum consummavero, et assignavero eis fructum hunc: per vos proficiscar in Hispaniam.

verses.textEn: And I know that when I come to you I shall arrive with an abundance of the blessings of the Gospel of Christ.
verses.textLa: Scio autem quoniam veniens ad vos, in abundantia benedictionis Evangelii Christi veniam.

verses.textEn: Therefore, I beg you, brothers, through our Lord Jesus Christ and through the love of the Holy Spirit, that you assist me with your prayers to God on my behalf,
verses.textLa: Obsecro ergo vos fratres per Dominum nostrum Iesum Christum, et per charitatem Sancti Spiritus, ut adiuvetis me in orationibus vestris pro me ad Deum,

verses.textEn: so that I may be freed from the unfaithful who are in Judea, and so that the oblation of my service may be acceptable to the saints in Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: ut liberer ab infidelibus, qui sunt in Iudæa, et obsequii mei oblatio accepta fiat in Ierusalem sanctis,

verses.textEn: So may I come to you with joy, through the will of God, and so may I be refreshed with you.
verses.textLa: ut veniam ad vos in gaudio per voluntatem Dei, et refrigerer vobiscum.

verses.textEn: And may the God of peace be with you all. Amen.
verses.textLa: Deus autem pacis sit cum omnibus vobis. Amen.

verses.textEn: Now I commend to you our sister Phoebe, who is in the ministry of the church, which is at Cenchreae,
verses.textLa: Commendo autem vobis Phœben sororem nostram, quæ est in ministerio Ecclesiæ, quæ est in Cenchris:

verses.textEn: so that you may receive her in the Lord with the worthiness of the saints, and so that you may be of assistance to her in whatever task she will have need of you. For she herself has also assisted many, and myself also.
verses.textLa: ut eam suscipiatis in Domino digne sanctis: et assistatis ei in quocumque negotio vestri indiguerit: etenim ipsa quoque astitit multis, et mihi ipsi.

verses.textEn: Greet Prisca and Aquila, my helpers in Christ Jesus,
verses.textLa: Salutate Priscam, et Aquilam adiutores meos in Christo Iesu;

verses.textEn: who have risked their own necks on behalf of my life, for whom I give thanks, not I alone, but also all the churches of the Gentiles;
verses.textLa: (qui pro anima mea suas cervices supposuerunt: quibus non solus ego gratias ago, sed et cunctæ ecclesiæ Gentium)

verses.textEn: and greet the church at their house. Greet Epaenetus, my beloved, who is among the first-fruits of Asia in Christ.
verses.textLa: et domesticam Ecclesiam eorum. Salutate Epænetum dilectum mihi, qui est primitivus Asiæ in Christo.

verses.textEn: Greet Mary, who has labored much among you.
verses.textLa: Salutate Mariam, quæ multum laboravit in vobis.

verses.textEn: Greet Andronicus and Junias, my kinsmen and fellow captives, who are noble among the Apostles, and who were in Christ prior to me.
verses.textLa: Salutate Andronicum, et Iuniam cognatos, et concaptivos meos: qui sunt nobiles in Apostolis, qui et ante me fuerunt in Christo.

verses.textEn: Greet Ampliatus, most beloved to me in the Lord.
verses.textLa: Salutate Ampliatum dilectissimum mihi in Domino.

verses.textEn: Greet Urbanus, our helper in Christ Jesus, and Stachys, my beloved.
verses.textLa: Salutate Urbanum adiutorem nostrum in Christo Iesu, et Stachyn dilectum meum.

verses.textEn: Greet Apelles, who has been tested in Christ.
verses.textLa: Salutate Apellen probum in Christo.

verses.textEn: Greet those who are from the household of Aristobulus. Greet Herodian, my kinsman. Greet those who are of the household of Narcissus, who are in the Lord.
verses.textLa: Salutate eos, qui sunt ex Aristoboli domo. Salutate Herodionem cognatum meum. Salutate eos, qui sunt ex Narcissi domo, qui sunt in Domino.

verses.textEn: Greet Tryphaena and Tryphosa, who labor in the Lord. Greet Persis, most beloved, who has labored much in the Lord.
verses.textLa: Salutate Tryphænam, et Tryphosam: quæ laborant in Domino. Salutate Persidem charissimam, quæ multum laboravit in Domino.

verses.textEn: Greet Rufus, elect in the Lord, and his mother and mine.
verses.textLa: Salutate Rufum electum in Domino, et matrem eius, et meam.

verses.textEn: Greet Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermas, Patrobas, Hermes, and the brothers who are with them.
verses.textLa: Salutate Asyncritum, Phlegontem, Hermam, Patrobam, Hermen: et qui cum eis sunt, fratres.

verses.textEn: Greet Philologus and Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints who are with them.
verses.textLa: Salutate Philologum, et Iuliam, Nereum, et sororem eius, et Olympiadem, et omnes, qui cum eis sunt, sanctos.

verses.textEn: Greet one another with a holy kiss. All the churches of Christ greet you.
verses.textLa: Salutate invicem in osculo sancto. Salutant vos omnes Ecclesiæ Christi.

verses.textEn: But I beg you, brothers, to take note of those who cause dissensions and offenses contrary to the doctrine that you have learned, and to turn away from them.
verses.textLa: Rogo autem vos fratres, ut observetis eos, qui dissensiones, et offendicula præter doctrinam, quam vos didicistis, faciunt, et declinate ab illis.

verses.textEn: For ones such as these do not serve Christ our Lord, but their inner selves, and, through pleasing words and skillful speaking, they seduce the hearts of the innocent.
verses.textLa: Huiuscemodi enim Christo Domino nostro non serviunt, sed suo ventri: et per dulces sermones, et benedictiones seducunt corda innocentium.

verses.textEn: But your obedience has been made known in every place. And so, I rejoice in you. But I want you to be wise in what is good, and simple in what is evil.
verses.textLa: Vestra enim obedientia in omnem locum divulgata est. Gaudeo igitur in vobis. Sed volo vos sapientes esse in bono, et simplices in malo.

verses.textEn: And may the God of peace quickly crush Satan under your feet. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
verses.textLa: Deus autem pacis conterat Satanam sub pedibus vestris velociter. Gratia Domini nostri Iesu Christi vobiscum.

verses.textEn: Timothy, my fellow laborer, greets you, and Lucius and Jason and Sosipater, my kinsmen.
verses.textLa: Salutat vos Timotheus adiutor meus, et Lucius, et Iason, et Sosipater cognati mei.

verses.textEn: I, Tertius, who wrote this epistle, greet you in the Lord.
verses.textLa: Saluto vos ego Tertius, qui scripsi epistolam, in Domino.

verses.textEn: Gaius, my host, and the entire church, greets you. Erastus, the treasurer of the city, greets you, and Quartus, a brother.
verses.textLa: Salutat vos Caius hospes meus, et universa Ecclesia. Salutat vos Erastus arcarius civitatis, et Quartus, frater.

verses.textEn: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
verses.textLa: Gratia Domini nostri Iesu Christi cum omnibus vobis. Amen.

verses.textEn: But to him who is able to confirm you according to my Gospel and the preaching of Jesus Christ, in accord with the revelation of the mystery which has been hidden from time immemorial,
verses.textLa: Ei autem, qui potens est vos confirmare iuxta Evangelium meum, et prædicationem Iesu Christi, secundum revelationem mysterii temporibus æternis taciti,

verses.textEn: (which now has been made clear through the Scriptures of the Prophets, in accord with the precept of the eternal God, unto the obedience of faith) which has been made known among all the Gentiles:
verses.textLa: (quod nunc patefactum est per Scripturas Prophetarum secundum præceptum æterni Dei, ad obeditionem fidei) in cunctis Gentibus cogniti,

verses.textEn: to God, who alone is wise, through Jesus Christ, to him be honor and glory forever and ever. Amen.
verses.textLa: soli sapienti Deo, per Iesum Christum, cui honor, et gloria in sæcula sæculorum. Amen.
